checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 32 conversion actions configured. Without conversion tracking, Google cannot optimize bids, and all campaign data becomes unreliable for decision-making.

checks.name: Enhanced conversions enabled
checks.finding: Enhanced conversions or offline import detected — this recovers conversion data lost due to cookie restrictions and privacy changes, improving Smart Bidding accuracy by 5-15%.

checks.name: Server-side tracking
checks.finding: Server-side or offline conversion import active — this provides more reliable data than client-side tracking alone, as it bypasses ad blockers and browser restrictions.

checks.name: Consent Mode v2 (EU/EEA)
checks.finding: EU targeting unclear from available data. If targeting EU/EEA users, Consent Mode v2 is legally required since March 2024 and enables conversion modeling for consenting users.

checks.name: Conversion window appropriate
checks.finding: 10 conversion categories detected (2x GET_DIRECTIONS, 2x ENGAGEMENT, 12x PAGE_VIEW, 4x PHONE_CALL_LEAD, 2x PURCHASE, 2x BEGIN_CHECKOUT, 2x ADD_TO_CART, 3x CONTACT, 1x UNKNOWN, 2x DEFAULT). Verify the conversion window matches your sales cycle — high-ticket items need 60-90 day windows, while impulse purchases only need 7-30 days.

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Good separation — only macro conversions (purchases, leads, calls) are set as Primary. This ensures Smart Bidding optimizes for real business outcomes, not inflated micro-actions.

checks.name: Attribution model
checks.finding: Cannot verify attribution model via API. Google now defaults to data-driven attribution which uses machine learning to distribute credit. Verify in Settings > Conversions that data-driven is selected for primary actions.

checks.name: Conversion value assignment
checks.finding: No primary actions to assess.

checks.name: No duplicate counting
checks.finding: Potential duplicates found: 2x "purchase" actions; 2x "phone" actions; 6x "call" actions. Duplicate tracking inflates conversion counts by 2-3x, making CPA appear artificially low and causing Smart Bidding to overbid. Remove duplicates and keep only one source per conversion type (prefer GA4 over tag-based tracking).

checks.name: GA4 linked and flowing
checks.finding: GA4 conversion actions detected and linked. GA4 provides cross-device tracking, better attribution modeling, and audience data that improves targeting across campaigns.

checks.name: Google Tag firing
checks.finding: 32 active actions recording 13 conversions in 30d. Tags are firing and data is flowing.

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: Active search campaigns detected — search terms should be reviewed weekly. Google matches queries broadly, and without regular reviews, 20-40% of spend typically goes to irrelevant searches. Check Insights > Search Terms for the last 7 days and add negatives for any non-converting, irrelevant terms.

checks.name: Negative keyword lists exist
checks.finding: 2 list(s) with 147 total keywords. Need at least 3 themed lists (e.g., Competitors, Job Seekers, Irrelevant Services) to properly filter traffic. A well-maintained negative list typically saves 15-20% of wasted spend.

checks.name: Account-level negatives applied
checks.finding: Negative keyword lists exist — verify they are applied to ALL active campaigns including Shopping and PMax. Unattached lists provide zero protection. Check Tools > Shared Library > Negative Keyword Lists.

checks.name: Wasted spend on irrelevant terms
checks.finding: ~78.95% of top product spend ($2010) goes to zero-conversion products. This is a significant budget leak — reallocate spend from zero-converting products to proven winners. Use product group subdivisions to exclude or lower bids on non-performers, and increase bids on high-ROAS products.

checks.name: Broad match + smart bidding pairing
checks.finding: Verify broad match keywords are paired with Smart Bidding (tROAS or tCPA). Broad match without Smart Bidding causes uncontrolled query expansion and wasted spend. Google's AI needs Smart Bidding to constrain broad match effectively.

checks.name: Close variant pollution
checks.finding: Requires search term report analysis. Close variants can cause exact/phrase match keywords to match unintended queries — review Search Terms for unexpected matches.

checks.name: Search term visibility
checks.finding: Google only shows ~30-40% of actual search terms. Review the visible terms regularly and use scripts or third-party tools to maximize visibility into what queries are triggering your ads.

checks.name: Zero-conversion keywords
checks.finding: Review keywords that have spent more than 2x your target CPA without converting. These should be paused or moved to exact match with lower bids. Zero-conversion keywords are the #1 source of wasted search spend.

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: 3 naming prefix(es) across 3 campaigns. Consistent naming convention in place — makes filtering, reporting, and management significantly easier.

checks.name: Ad group naming convention
checks.finding: 2 total ad groups. Manageable ad group count.

checks.name: Single theme ad groups
checks.finding: Verify each ad group contains tightly themed keywords (STAGs). Mixed themes reduce Quality Score because ad copy cannot match all keywords equally, increasing CPC by 50-400%. Each ad group should target one core intent.

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: 3 campaigns: 1 SEARCH, 1 DISPLAY, 1 SHOPPING. Healthy campaign count — sufficient data per campaign for optimization.

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: CRITICAL: No brand campaign exists. Competitors can bid on your brand name and steal clicks at a low cost. Brand campaigns typically have 30-50x ROAS with $0.50-$1.50 CPCs. Create a dedicated brand Search campaign immediately with exact and phrase match brand keywords.

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: No active PMax campaigns. For e-commerce and lead gen, PMax often outperforms standard campaigns by leveraging Google's full inventory. Consider launching with strong asset groups and audience signals.

checks.name: Search + PMax overlap
checks.finding: No concurrent Search + PMax running.

checks.name: Budget allocation matches priority
checks.finding: 3 active campaign(s), $248/day budget, Search Impression Share 27%. Capturing only 27% of available impressions means 73% of potential customers never see your ads. Consider increasing budget on proven campaigns or consolidating to focus spend.

checks.name: Campaign daily budget vs spend
checks.finding: $248 daily budget, ~$104 actual daily spend. Under-delivery indicates targeting is too narrow, bids too low, or Quality Score issues are limiting ad eligibility. Check keyword status, ad approval, and bid competitiveness.

checks.name: Ad schedule configured
checks.finding: Ad schedule review requires campaign-level schedule data. Consider dayparting if conversion rates vary significantly by hour — analyze hourly performance in the Time report.

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: CRITICAL: Using "Presence or Interest" geo targeting, which shows ads to people merely interested in your location — not physically there. For local businesses, this wastes 10-30% of budget on users who will never convert. Switch to "Presence: People in or regularly in your targeted locations" in campaign Settings > Locations > Location options.

checks.name: Network settings
checks.finding: Network settings properly configured — Search campaigns are not leaking budget to Display Network.

checks.name: Quality Score checks
checks.finding: No Quality Score data available. QS requires sufficient impression history — new keywords need time to accumulate data.

checks.name: Zero-impression keywords
checks.finding: 8180 keywords configured: 3897 BROAD, 3328 PHRASE, 955 EXACT. Review keywords with zero impressions in the last 30 days — they may be too restrictive, have low search volume, or be outranked by other keywords in the same ad group. Pause or restructure these to reduce clutter.

checks.name: Keyword-to-ad relevance
checks.finding: Cannot assess relevance without QS data.

checks.name: RSA checks
checks.finding: 0 Responsive Search Ads found, 0 with Good/Excellent Ad Strength. Every active ad group needs at least 1 RSA with 15 headlines and 4 descriptions. RSAs allow Google to test 32,760+ combinations to find the best-performing message for each search.

checks.name: PMax asset checks
checks.finding: No active PMax campaigns. For e-commerce and lead gen, PMax often outperforms standard campaigns by leveraging Google's full inventory. Consider launching with strong asset groups and audience signals.

checks.name: Ad copy relevance to keywords
checks.finding: Verify ad headlines include primary keywords. Keyword insertion in headlines improves CTR by 10-15% on average because ads appear more relevant to the searcher's query. Use dynamic keyword insertion (DKI) or manually include top keywords in at least 3 headlines.

checks.name: Ad freshness
checks.finding: 4 total ads across all campaigns. Creative fatigue reduces CTR by 20-40% over time. Test new ad variations every 4-6 weeks — try different value propositions, CTAs, and emotional angles. Always keep a control ad running alongside tests.

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: Account CTR is 1.01%. Below the 2% minimum threshold. Low CTR increases CPC and reduces Quality Score. Review ad copy for relevance, check keyword match types, and ensure ads align with search intent.

checks.name: PMax audience signals
checks.finding: No active PMax.

checks.name: PMax Ad Strength
checks.finding: No active PMax.

checks.name: PMax brand cannibalization
checks.finding: No active PMax.

checks.name: PMax search themes
checks.finding: No active PMax.

checks.name: PMax negative keywords
checks.finding: No active PMax.

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Using Manual CPC with 13 conversions/month. Smart Bidding needs 15+ conversions/month to optimize effectively — Manual CPC is partially justified but limits performance. Consider Maximize Clicks as a stepping stone to build conversion volume, then switch to Target ROAS or Target CPA.

checks.name: Budget constrained campaigns
checks.finding: Search Impression Share is 27%. You're only showing for 27% of eligible searches — missing 73% of potential customers. This is the single biggest growth opportunity: increasing budget or improving Quality Score would put your ads in front of significantly more qualified searchers.

checks.name: Manual CPC justification
checks.finding: 13 conversions/month with Manual CPC. Below the 15-conversion threshold for reliable Smart Bidding — focus on building conversion volume first. Use Maximize Clicks to increase traffic, improve conversion tracking accuracy, then transition to Smart Bidding once you reach 15+ conversions/month.

checks.name: Sitelink extensions
checks.finding: 56 sitelink asset(s) configured. Sitelinks increase CTR by 10-20% by providing additional links to key pages (pricing, reviews, specific products). They also increase ad real estate, pushing competitors further down the page.

checks.name: Callout extensions
checks.finding: 102 callout asset(s) configured. Callouts highlight key benefits (Free Shipping, 24/7 Support, Price Match) and increase CTR by 5-10%. They require no additional landing pages.

checks.name: Structured snippets
checks.finding: 4 structured_snippet asset(s) configured. Structured snippets showcase product categories, services, or features under standardized headers. They pre-qualify clicks by setting expectations before the user clicks.

checks.name: Image extensions
checks.finding: 568 image asset(s) configured. Image extensions make ads 2-3x more visually prominent on mobile, increasing CTR significantly. Critical for product-based businesses where visual appeal drives clicks.

checks.name: Call extensions
checks.finding: 6 call asset(s) configured. Call extensions add a clickable phone number to ads, essential for businesses where phone calls are a primary conversion action. Phone leads typically convert 30-50% higher than form fills.

checks.name: Audience segments applied
checks.finding: 25 remarketing/audience list(s) configured. Remarketing audiences convert 3-5x higher than cold traffic because they've already shown interest in your business. Ensure these lists are applied to campaigns as observation layers (for bid adjustments) or targeting layers (for RLSA campaigns).

checks.name: Customer Match lists
checks.finding: 1 Customer Match list(s) uploaded. These first-party data lists enable: (1) Exclusion of existing customers from acquisition campaigns, (2) Cross-sell/upsell targeting to past purchasers, (3) Similar audience expansion to find new high-value prospects.

quickWins.action: Remove duplicate conversion actions: Go to Goals > Conversions and identify actions tracking the same event (e.g., GA4 Purchase + Shopify Purchase). Keep one source per conversion type and set duplicates to Secondary.
Pause or add negative product groups for zero-converting products with >$100 spend. Redirect that budget to proven high-ROAS products instead.

Create a brand Search campaign: Add exact and phrase match keywords for your brand name. Set budget to capture 95%+ impression share. Brand campaigns typically achieve 30-50x ROAS with $0.50-$1.50 CPCs.

Fix geo targeting: In each campaign, go to Settings > Locations > Location options. Change from "Presence or Interest" to "Presence: People in or regularly in your targeted locations." This stops ads from showing to out-of-area users.
No Quality Score data available. QS requires sufficient impression history — new keywords need time to accumulate data.

0 Responsive Search Ads found, 0 with Good/Excellent Ad Strength. Every active ad group needs at least 1 RSA with 15 headlines and 4 descriptions. RSAs allow Google to test 32,760+ combinations to find the best-performing message for each search.

Search Impression Share is 27%. You're only showing for 27% of eligible searches — missing 73% of potential customers. This is the single biggest growth opportunity: increasing budget or improving Quality Score would put your ads in front of significantly more qualified searchers.

items: Clean up conversion tracking — audit all conversion actions, set only true business outcomes (Purchase, Lead Form, Phone Call) as Primary, and set all micro-actions (page views, add-to-cart, engagements) to Secondary. This is the single most impactful change because it fixes the data that drives all optimization decisions.

Launch a brand Search campaign immediately to protect your branded search terms. Competitors can bid on your brand name at low cost. Create exact + phrase match keywords for your brand name, set a sufficient budget to capture 95%+ impression share. Brand campaigns typically deliver 30-50x ROAS.

Test Smart Bidding via campaign experiments: Create an experiment in Settings > Experiments, testing Target ROAS (set 20% below your current ROAS as starting target) or Maximize Conversions against Manual CPC. Run for 2-3 weeks to compare. Smart Bidding typically improves ROAS by 20-30%.

Launch a PMax campaign with proper setup: Create asset groups by product category or service type, each with 20 images (various aspect ratios), 5 videos, 5 headlines, 5 descriptions, and audience signals (customer lists + website visitors + in-market segments). Start with a daily budget of 3x your target CPA.

Refresh ad creative: Test new headline angles (features vs benefits vs urgency vs social proof), update ad descriptions with current offers, and add all available extensions (sitelinks, callouts, structured snippets, images). Creative testing every 4-6 weeks prevents fatigue-driven CTR decline.

Increase Search Impression Share from 27.01% toward 50%+ on converting campaigns. This is done by increasing budget, improving Quality Score, and consolidating campaigns to focus spend where it performs best.
Test Demand Gen campaigns for upper-funnel awareness — these reach users across YouTube, Gmail, and Discover with visually engaging ads, driving new-to-brand traffic at lower CPMs than Search.
Implement server-side tracking via server-side GTM or direct API conversion imports to improve data quality by 10-25%. This ensures Smart Bidding has the most accurate conversion signals possible.
